title: Ticket #6962: Test OpenSSL 1.1.0-only code in TOKEN authentication method
description:
Fedora 27 and Debian 9 (our two OpenSSL 1.1.0 platforms) both failed to build the TOKEN code as merged for #6947. Although the fixes appear to be trivial, I'm now worried that the OpenSSL 1.1.0 -specific code has never been tested.

Brian, I'd like to know what you did to test the other version of the code just because we need regression tests for the TOKEN code, but without that information, I think we'll have to disable the OpenSSL 1.1.0 -specific code until someone who knows crypto can take a good look at it. I'm assuming here that the code for earlier version of OpenSSL will work for 1.1.0; if not, we'll need to disable the whole thing.
remarks:
2020-Apr-10 07:46:13 by tim:
Bulk change of target version from v080906 to v080907 using ticket-target-mover.
creator: tlmiller
